page.title: Questions - Main Clause Yes/No Questions
page.introduction: In English, main clause Yes/No questions are formed by moving an auxiliary verb in front of the subject. Other languages use a Yes/No question marker or special complementizer instead of the fronted auxiliary. (English does this in embedded Yes/No questions.) English examples of main clause Yes/No questions are:

EnglishExample.exItem: Are you going to the store?
Will Sue buy the present for her mother?
Could the boy have hit the ball?
